reference.title: javapackage
reference.shortdesc: The <javapackage> element is a reference to a Java package.

section.title: Description
section.p: This element can be used to reference a Java package from another topic type.

This element has the following attributes: href, keyref, type, format, scope(local | peer | external), and outputclass. The keyref attribute must provide a unique key such as a fully qualified class name for the named API item.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <task id="httpxml"> <title>Getting an XML file through an HTTP connection</title> <taskbody> <steps> <step><cm>Open the connection</cm> <info>You can use <javapackage keyref="com.ibm.xtools.patterns.framework.uml2">UML2 modeling package</javapackage> in a Java application.</info> </step> ... </steps> </taskbody> </task>
